title: Low Priority Que
body:
So about a month ago my internet sh#t itself out of no where (thanks telstra) and I began lagging and dcing randomly throughout the day. I played a game and dced and thought alright I'll leave it for a few hours and hope it stops. Low and behold, it happens again. Out of rage I stop playing for a few days then come back, and manage to play a game without dcing. This is when I think maybe my internet is back to normal. Oh no, I was wrong. I dced again and again until I got this awesome new 20 minute wait que. I stopped playing for literally a good month due to that really cool feature. I decided enough was enough and pushed through the cancerous 5 game 20 minute wait. So just today I was playing with my two mates and whats that? I can't see the load screen. Ok I'll restart the pc. I go to log in and reconnect but wait I can't. After 2 minutes of trying I get back in right as the minions spawn. Walk into lane poke my enemy down to half health and go in for the first blood, too easy. "why can't I move?". I now have dced yet again. So in a massive rage I try and join back as fast as possible and dc again. After maybe 4 attempts I give up and play another game. 

After getting home from work I felt like playing a game or two of league. I see the message about low priority que. "F##k". SO YET AGAIN I have to wait 20 minutes for 5 games due to telstra being sh#t. I would be extremely happy if this que could be removed or at least my timer set to maybe 5 minutes?

replies.body:
>Under no circumstances will we remove any low priority queues from your account.

Not a direct quote but that's how I remember it. Sorry man.

Have you tried renewing your IP address and flushing your DNS?
Na man I'm not really sure how to do that lol

[Here's Riot's official instructions on how to do it on Windows.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq10)

Basically, open the command prompt as an admin, then type in,

>ipconfig /release

>ipconfig /renew

>ipconfig /flushdns

with the Enter key being hit between each command. Then restart your computer.

If you're on Mac, just hit the "Mac" button at the top of the page I sent you to!

Best of luck.
